data.name: Suspicious eMail Attached
data.demo_message:
1) Malicious Email as Attachement reported by user
2) Auto-reply: Email received (show email client)
3) Body/Header Artifacts [file,url,domain...] extracted/rated (Show rating Playbook)
4) Existing indicators linked
5) Some indicators are malicious
6) Block original sender on FortiMail (show FML)
7) Block URLs on FortiGate (show fortigate and/or Blacklist webserver)
Send Block notification to the reporter/all recipients
8) Create a Task for EIS to handle the case and notify them

body.text:
Hi Team,
Please check this email, it looks suspicious

user
+5473542145

headers.subject: Fwd: Immediate action required
headers.received: from Exch19.fortielab.com ([::1]) by Exch19.fortielab.com ([::1]) with mapi id 15.02.0529.005; Thu, 25 Jun 2020 19:08:39 -0700

body.html:
Hello,

This is an automated official communication from FortiELAB IT Client ServicesTicket system about the incident number below.

Ticket INC1147653 has been created from the recent activities in your CalNet - ID credentials.

ITCS system have detected an irregular activity related to your FortiELAB Inc CalNet ID credentials. As a precautionary measure, we willtemporary block your account and should be moving it to our backup server butwe need your help to do this effectively otherwise you may lose your logininformation and data at the end of the Duo Account Migration & Quarantineclean-up process.

To regain and secure access to your FortiELAB Inc CalNetID credentials, kindly confirm the below requested information to enable usmigrate your FortiELAB Inc CalNet ID credentials toa  DUO 2-factor authentication Symantec Endpoint Protection Communicationsoftware and register it to a new SPAM filtering service which will improveyour Firewall Email Security Overview and the ability to identify and blockSpam/Phishing attempts automatically and other undesirable messages that floodour email system on a daily basis.

You can resolve your ticket by doing  the following:

- Click on the below link to download the instructions file which you need to fill and send to the indicated email addressCalNet ID credentials;   
Click HERE

- Save the attached instructions file to your computer, fill the form and send it to the indicated email address

Note: We will permanently deactivate and delete your FortiELAB Inc CalNet ID credentials if you do not adhere to this noticeimmediately as part of our Inactive ID credentials clean-up process to enableservice upgrade efficiency.
Thanks,
ITCS
FortiELAB Inc IT Client Services
Copyright ï¿½ 2021 FortiELAB Corp
--------------
You received this email because you have submitted a ticket into ServiceNow.

data.name: Suspicious eMail Inline
data.demo_message: Alert: Malicious Email Attached Inline Sent

body.html:
MIS Team, Please investigate the forwarded email below, it looks suspicious. Thank you
user
Financial Analyst
+9754235452
From: CTO Office
Date: {{TR_FORMATTED_CURRENT_TIME}}
To: User
CC: "user{{TR_POD_NUMBER}}@fortielab.com"
Subject:Critical Patch to Apply
A Critical vulnerability has been found in our internal ERP client application
, a patch has been made available in our internal website Windows Patch
. It is mandatory for all employes to download it and install it immediately.

Office of the CTO

headers.subject: Fw: Critical Patch to Apply
